capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm not a fan of the way the Filch is treated in our school, to be honest. He's just trying to do his job as an administrator, but nobody gives him any respect. I think he deserves more understanding and appreciation from us students.

capsules_submitted.utterance: I'm really proud to say that I have a strong affinity for the Hogwarts school of magic. The wood affiliation is just so fitting for me, don't you think? It's like the trees and the forest are calling out to me, telling me that this is where I belong. I can totally see myself studying here, surrounded by all the ancient magic and wisdom.

I'm a huge fan of the Hogwarts houses, and I've always been particularly drawn to Gryffindor. The idea of being part of a community that values bravery and daring is really appealing to me. And, as it happens, I've had some pretty intense experiences with wood in my time at Hogwarts - remember that time we were forced to make our own wands from the wood of the Whomping Willow?
